summary: This document is a detailed video review log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) covering the period from 4pm on August 9, 2019, to 7am on August 10, 2019. It meticulously records the movements of officers, inmates, and other personnel around the Special Housing Unit (SHU), specifically noting activity near Door 46 (an access point to cell 10S), desk areas, and various tiers. The log captures routine custodial operations, cleaning activities, and security checks leading up to and following the time of Jeffrey Epstein's death.

persons.name: Officer Noel
persons.context: Frequently mentioned officer moving throughout the SHU, escorting inmates, providing access to tiers for cleaning, and entering/exiting Door 46.

persons.name: Officer Thomas
persons.context: Mentioned once as a person wearing a dark hoodie who entered Door 46 around 5:37 AM.

persons.name: Black Male (BM)
persons.context: An unidentified Black male officer or staff member involved in various tasks, including moving carts, handling trash bags, and accessing Door 46.

persons.name: Black Female (BF)
persons.context: An unidentified Black female officer or staff member, sometimes speculated to be Officer Noel, involved in movements and accessing Door 46.

persons.name: Lighter skin toned female (LF) / Lt.
persons.context: An unidentified lighter-skinned female, possibly a lieutenant, seen accessing Door 46 and handling papers at the desk area in the early morning.

connections.description: The log speculates that the Black Female observed in several entries is likely Officer Noel, indicating they are the same person.
Both are correctional officers recorded as working in the same SHU area during the same shift.
Officer Noel is repeatedly recorded escorting inmates and providing them access to tiers for cleaning duties.

events.title: Video Surveillance of MCC SHU
events.description: Continuous video monitoring and logging of all movement in the Special Housing Unit area, including officer rounds, inmate cleaning, and access to Door 46.

events.title: Start of 10 PM Inmate Count
events.description: The log notes that officer movements holding papers likely signify the start of the standard 10 PM inmate count, with officers moving to various tiers (L, M, J, K, H).

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) - Special Housing Unit (SHU)
Tiers: J Tier, K Tier, H Tier, G Tier, L Tier, M Tier
keyFacts: The document is a forensic video review log created for the period immediately before and after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.
Door 46 is explicitly identified as "a way to get to 10S from the SHU," which was Epstein's cell.
Activity log shows frequent, routine access to Door 46 by multiple correctional officers (Noel, Thomas, BM, BF, LF) throughout the night for various purposes.
The log details standard prison operations including inmate cleaning details, officer counts, and general movement, with no explicit mention of Epstein or unusual incidents.
The meticulous, minute-by-minute recording suggests this document was generated as part of the post-incident investigation into Epstein's death.
